{"step_by_step_thinking": "Lowering the cut-off point for the screening test would result in an increase in the number of individuals who are classified as positive for tuberculosis. This would lead to an increase in the number of true negatives (individuals who do not have tuberculosis and are correctly identified as negative) and a decrease in the number of false negatives (individuals who have tuberculosis but are incorrectly identified as negative). Therefore, lowering the cut-off point would result in an increase in the negative predictive value, which is the proportion of individuals who test negative and truly do not have the disease.", "answer_choice": "C. Negative predictive value"}
